== Example for an adapter
=== Target Let's try to implement a real world adapter like a power adapter. Basically different countries sometimes have different electrical sockets and in order to make different electrical sockets work together with a different plugs the use of adapters is necessary.
image::adapter.jpg" scale="30" />
Adapter in real life
=== The model for getting electricity
These classes make clear that only `UKPlugConnectors` can be plugged into a `UKElectricalSocket` and only `GermanPlugConnectors` can be plugged into a `GermanElectricalSocket` .
Fortunately an `UKElectricalSocket` can also be used with a `GermanPlugConnector` by using an adapter. This can be archived by wrapping a `GermanPlugConnector` in a `UKPlugConnector` .
=== Creating an adapter for plug connectors
To use the `UKElectricalSocket` 's `plugIn` method an `UKPlugConnector` has to be used. Therefore the `GermanPlugConnector` is wrapped in a new class, which implements the `UKPlugConnector` interface.
